value.0: << ACTOR 5 >>

<StartAction>[You rise and stretch, your footsteps soft upon the stone floor of this tiny room. "I'm getting old," you realize. But it wasn't always so, you tell yourself, reaching once again for the pen, dipping it ink.]</Start>
<StartAction>[For the first time in months, you find yourself recalling the events leading to your initiation into the ShadowGuard ranks... thoughts which inevitably lead to your father...]</Start>
<StartAction>[Frustrated, you allow the memory of your time in Ghaarak to overtake you. The day of your graduation still haunts you, even now...]</Start>

For a large portion of my young life, I had come to age in the southern cities of the Sharakhan Empire, trained among the advanced academies of the Empire's heartlands, entering <man/woman>hood among those peaceful lands...

My father was Okaris <LastName>, a general of the Sharakhan army who enjoyed the favor of Emperor Rakha. His fame ensured my mother and I had few wishes which went unfulfilled, and we lived a life of luxury and ease.

I saw very little of my father himself, however. Always campaigning with his men in the north, my father was not one for the simple pleasures of home, and years would pass between his visits to see my mother and me.
I must confess I had little desire to know my father much further than the visiting stranger he had become, and it always seemed to me that he felt much the same way...

But destiny often takes strange turns we do not expect, and in the year 1370, my mother took ill to the Red Plague spreading throughout the south. Within three months, she was dead, leaving me alone upon our rich plantation...
My father had recently taken the position of ruling Magistrate over the city of Ghaarak, an Imperial colony along the outermost fringes of the wild frontier known as the Northern Reaches.
His duties keeping him as busy as they did, my father barely arrived in time to share a few last words with my mother before she departed this world forever...

After my mother's funeral, my father and I were left with the awkward decision of what fate would befall me. In many ways, I would have preferred to stay upon our plantation home in the south, and make my own destiny.
But my father had other ideas. At his bidding, I was brought to live among the Imperial citizens of Ghaarak, to finish my training at the Imperial Academy under my father's care.
Life upon this wild land proved very different from that of the civilized cities of the south, and I felt quite alone among my new home in Ghaarak...
Though we now lived within the walls of the same city, I saw my father little more than I had before, for he was always on official business with his duties as the city's Magistrate.

Still, my time was not completely wasted, and I worked night and day to finish my training at the Imperial Academy, in the hope that I might yet be free to make my way in the world as my own <man/woman>.
Unbeknownst to me at the time, life was soon to take a turn that would change my fate forever...
Looking back on it now, I can see that it all began on that fateful day, when I was summoned to the Imperial Academy to perform my graduation ceremony...
<StartAction>[As the memory of your past takes its grip on you, you let yourself succumb to its will, allowing your mind to travel back to the Imperial Academy of Ghaarak...]</Start>

For a large portion of my young life, I had come to age in the southern cities of the Sharakhan Empire, trained among the advanced academies of the Empire's heartlands, leaving my childhood among those peaceful lands.

My father's name was Okaris <LastName>, and he was a general of the Sharakhan army who enjoyed the favor of Emperor Rakha. His fame ensured my mother and I had few wishes which went unfulfilled, and we lived a life of luxury and ease.

I saw very little of my father himself, however. Always campaigning with his men in the north, my father was not one for the simple pleasures of home, and years would pass between his visits to see my mother and me.
I must confess I had little desire to know my father much further than the visiting stranger he had become, and it always seemed to me that he felt much the same way...

His duties keeping him as busy as they did, my father barely arrived in time to share a few last words with my mother before she departed this world forever...

After my mother's funeral, my father and I were left with the awkward decision of what fate would befall me. In many ways, I would have preferred to stay upon our plantation home in the south, and make my own destiny.
But my father had other ideas. At his bidding, I was brought to live among the Imperial citizens of Ghaarak, to finish my training at the Imperial Academy under my father's care.

Looking back on it now, I can see that it all began on that fateful day, when I was summoned to the Imperial Academy to perform my graduation ceremony...

<StartAction>[Crumple the parchment and throw it to the floor.]</Start>
